body.p: The dynamic IPC message format is created to minimize number of IPC messages to be sent between firmware and flash interface. The dynamic message format operates on read/write headers. Each read/write header provides details of the operation to be performed such as number of buffers involved, number of ECC chunks involved etc.

The read header is used for flash read operations. There will be one or more read headers to operate on a single page (Refer usage example section for more details). The same read header is used for RAW mode flash read operations also.

Number of buffers involved in current read header.

The number of ECC chunks involved in current read header.
The starting ECC chunk number of the current read header.
The number of dwords to be dumped in the first ECC chunk (Starting ECC chunk) of the current read header..

body.p: The write header is used for flash write operations. There will be one write header to operate on single page (Refer usage example section for more details). The same write header is used for RAW mode flash write operations also.
